title: Question: How to tell spack to use bzip2 and zlib from system?
body:
With the current `develop` branch (5320268033570d93d40b431fc4d93893572bac0b) I get:

```
$ spack spec fairlogger@1.5.0+pretty
Input spec
--------------------------------
fairlogger@1.5.0+pretty

Concretized
--------------------------------
fairlogger@1.5.0%gcc@9.2.1 build_type=RelWithDebInfo cxxstd=default +pretty arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
    ^boost@1.72.0%gcc@9.2.1+atomic+chrono~clanglibcpp~container~context~coroutine cxxstd=98 +date_time~debug+exception~fiber+filesystem+graph~icu+iostreams+locale+log+math~mpi+multithreaded~numpy~pic+program_options~python+random+regex+serialization+shared+signals~singlethreaded+system~taggedlayout+test+thread+timer~versionedlayout visibility=hidden +wave arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
        ^bzip2@1.0.8%gcc@9.2.1+shared arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
            ^diffutils@3.7%gcc@9.2.1 arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
                ^libiconv@1.16%gcc@9.2.1 arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
        ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@9.2.1+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
    ^cmake@3.17.0%gcc@9.2.1~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
        ^ncurses@6.2%gcc@9.2.1~symlinks+termlib arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
            ^pkgconf@1.6.3%gcc@9.2.1 arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
        ^openssl@1.1.1f%gcc@9.2.1+systemcerts arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
            ^perl@5.30.1%gcc@9.2.1+cpanm+shared+threads arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
                ^gdbm@1.18.1%gcc@9.2.1 arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
                    ^readline@8.0%gcc@9.2.1 arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
```

Now marking several packages to be picked up from the system
```
$ cat ~/.spack/packages.yaml
packages:
  bzip2:
    paths:
      bzip2 os=fedora31: /usr
  cmake:
    paths:
      cmake os=fedora31: /usr
  zlib:
    paths:
      zlib os=fedora31: /usr
```
results in
```
$ spack spec fairlogger@1.5.0+pretty
Input spec
--------------------------------
fairlogger@1.5.0+pretty

Concretized
--------------------------------
fairlogger@1.5.0%gcc@9.2.1 build_type=RelWithDebInfo cxxstd=default +pretty arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
    ^boost@1.72.0%gcc@9.2.1+atomic+chrono~clanglibcpp~container~context~coroutine cxxstd=98 +date_time~debug+exception~fiber+filesystem+graph~icu+iostreams+locale+log+math~mpi+multithreaded~numpy~pic+program_options~python+random+regex+serialization+shared+signals~singlethreaded+system~taggedlayout+test+thread+timer~versionedlayout visibility=hidden +wave arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
        ^bzip2@1.0.8%gcc@9.2.1+shared arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
            ^diffutils@3.7%gcc@9.2.1 arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
                ^libiconv@1.16%gcc@9.2.1 arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
        ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@9.2.1+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
    ^cmake@3.17.0%gcc@9.2.1~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
```

Somehow this only works for `cmake`. However, tweaking the `packages.yaml` to be explicit about the target, achieves my goal:

```
$ cat ~/.spack/packages.yaml
packages:
  bzip2:
    paths:
      bzip2 os=fedora31 target=skylake: /usr
  cmake:
    paths:
      cmake os=fedora31: /usr
  zlib:
    paths:
      zlib os=fedora31 target=skylake: /usr
```
```
$ spack spec fairlogger@1.5.0+pretty
Input spec
--------------------------------
fairlogger@1.5.0+pretty

Concretized
--------------------------------
fairlogger@1.5.0%gcc@9.2.1 build_type=RelWithDebInfo cxxstd=default +pretty arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
    ^boost@1.72.0%gcc@9.2.1+atomic+chrono~clanglibcpp~container~context~coroutine cxxstd=98 +date_time~debug+exception~fiber+filesystem+graph~icu+iostreams+locale+log+math~mpi+multithreaded~numpy~pic+program_options~python+random+regex+serialization+shared+signals~singlethreaded+system~taggedlayout+test+thread+timer~versionedlayout visibility=hidden +wave arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
        ^bzip2@1.0.8%gcc@9.2.1+shared arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
        ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@9.2.1+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
    ^cmake@3.17.0%gcc@9.2.1~doc+ncurses+openssl+ownlibs~qt arch=linux-fedora31-skylake
```
```
$ spack install fairlogger@1.5.0+pretty
==> bzip2@1.0.8 : externally installed in /usr
==> bzip2@1.0.8 : generating module file
==> bzip2@1.0.8 : registering into DB
[+] /usr
==> zlib@1.2.11 : externally installed in /usr
==> zlib@1.2.11 : generating module file
==> zlib@1.2.11 : registering into DB
[+] /usr
==> cmake@3.17.0 : externally installed in /usr
==> cmake@3.17.0 : generating module file
==> cmake@3.17.0 : registering into DB
[+] /usr
==> 2093636: Installing boost
(...)
```

*  Why do I need to be explicit about the target for `bzip2` and `zlib` and not for `cmake` (dependency type?)?
*  If this is not a bug, how can I mark `bzip2` and `zlib` external without being explicit about the target?
